events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision at a traffic light, requesting immediate assistance.
The claim was categorized under 'Auto Accident' after reviewing the initial report and vehicle details provided by the claimant.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the customer's case and ensure thorough processing.
The insurance company sent an official acknowledgement to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Requested the customer to provide relevant documents including the police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted all required documents including the police report, damage photos, and repair invoices promptly.
The investigation team began the process of verifying the details of the auto accident and assessing liability.
Investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault for the collision after reviewing all evidence and reports.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the full repair costs and rental car fees deemed reasonable for the claim.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the timely support.
The auto accident claim was formally approved after acceptance of the settlement by the claimant.
Insurance payment for vehicle repairs and associated costs was issued to the claimant swiftly following approval.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after successful settlement and payment completion.
All documents and records related to the claim were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance.
